Steps.Instructions:
[FFFFFF]Procedure for task at hand[-]

[FFFFFF]DO NOT work on, perform maintenance, or repair capacitors until all capacitors are proven discharged as per this document.[-]

[FFFFFF]Do not touch the capacitors or any conductor attached to a capacitor before or during the discharge procedure[-]

[b][FFFFFF]Only authorised personnel are allowed to perform maintenance as per this procedure[-][/b]
Steps.Alerts: [b][FFFF00]Understanding the workflow and safety aspects of the task[-][/b][b][FFFFFF].[-][/b]
Steps.Title: Read through Standard Work Procedure

Steps.Instructions:
[FFFFFF]All individuals shall complete a Take 5 before commencing the task.[-]

[FFFFFF]Have the accompanying Standard Work Procedure at hand[-]

[FFFFFF]Personnel must at all times wear safety equipment issued to them as required by their location and task[-]

[FFFFFF]Gloves will be worn as per policy unless exemption stipulated in Take 5[-]
Steps.Alerts:
[FFFF00][b]Identifies all hazards associated with the task.[/b][-]

[FFFF00][b]No work commences until controls are implemented for any hazards identified in the task[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Complete a Take 5

Steps.Instructions:
[FFFFFF]Check the Multi-Meter for calibration and test date, if out of date do not use.[-]

[FFFFFF]Check for correct operation of Multi-Meter by measuring voltage of a known supply for example locomotive battery charge knife switch[-]
Steps.Alerts: [FFFF00][b]Testing is required to confirm working condition of test equipment on a known live source. Note: test gear should be re-tested after checking capacitors to confirm gear is still in working order.[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Check condition of test equipment

Steps.Instructions:
[FFFFFF]With the Engine running[-][FFFFFF], [-][FFFFFF]Open Aux cab door and check Capacitor Discharge lights [-][b][FFFFFF]are illuminated[-][/b]

[FFFFFF]Barrier bar must remain in the lowered position[-]

[b][FFFFFF]No Entry into the Auxiliary cab at this time is permitted[-][/b]
Steps.Alerts: [FFFF00][b]If the lights are not Illuminated you cannot use as verification of capacitor charge state[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Checking Discharge lights are ON

Steps.Instructions:
[FFFFFF]Shut down Diesel engine and Isolate at Battery switch & MBD switches in open position.[-]

[FFFFFF]L[-][FFFFFF]ock Battery Switch door in closed position with Personal Lock, place personal lock and tag, perform clear and trial by attempting to start diesel engine[-]
Steps.Alerts:
[b][FFFFFF]Take No[-][/b][b][FFFFFF]te:[-][/b]

[FFFF00][b]Makes others aware that the machine is under isolation[/b][-]

[FFFF00][b]Verifies isolation[/b][-]

[FFFF00][b]Complies with RTIO Isolation Regulations version 2.2[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Isolate Locomotive and verify Isolation

Steps.Instructions:
[FFFFFF]Raise Barrier bar and lock in raised position via catch[-][FFFFFF].[-]

[FFFFFF]Place Personal lock & tag as per isolation [-][FFFFFF]regulations[-][FFFFFF].[-]

[FFFFFF]Check DC Link voltage (CDI) lights are extinguished this should occur within [-][FFFFFF]approx.[-][FFFFFF] 200ms so unlikely that you will see the lights on at this stage[-]
Steps.Alerts:
[FFFF00][b]If the lights remain illuminated, then the capacitor discharge system is likely to have failed (voltage > 50VDC)[/b][-]

[FFFF00][b]Wait 20 minutes then See step 6 for Manual discharge prior to entry into Aux cab[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Checking Discharge lights are OFF

Steps.Instructions:
[FFFFFF]Turn the meter on and test basic meter functions by turning the function selector switch to the T position. The meter should indicate 090 or higher, [-][FFFFFF]i.e.[-][FFFFFF]: 9 volts.[-]

[FFFFFF]Low battery (less than 8 volts) is indicated by a symbol of a battery in the top left corner of the display. Battery should be replaced if reading is less than 075[-]
Steps.Alerts: [FFFF00][b]Ensure meter is functioning correctly[/b][-][FFFF00][b].[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Turn on meter and test basic functions

Steps.Instructions: [FFFFFF]T[-][FFFFFF]est the meter on battery charge knife switch by placing one test probe on the positive (+) Wire, 5BX Wire upper battery switch terminal and the other test probe on the negative (-) 5BY Wire upper battery switch terminal, you typically should see between 60 – 74Vdc displayed[-]
Steps.Alerts:
[b][FFFFFF]Take Not[-][/b][b][FFFFFF]e:[-][/b][FFFFFF] [-]

[FFFF00][b]Ensure meter is displaying correct voltage before proceeding with the next step.[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Test DC Voltmeter Meter - Before Use

Steps.Instructions:
[FFFFFF]Ensure suitably rated PPE gear is worn when performing this task[-]

[FFFFFF]Place one test probe on the positive (+) capacitor terminal, and the other test probe on the negative (-) capacitor terminal diagonally opposite, and record the voltage[-]

[FFFFFF]If voltage measured is less than 50VDC[-][FFFFFF],[-][FFFFFF] proceed to work step 5[-]

[FFFFFF]If voltage measured is Above 50VDC[-][FFFFFF],[-][FFFFFF] proceed to work step 6[-]
Steps.Alerts:
[FFFF00][b]There is a potential of up to 2000V DC if the laminated busbar has a failure and the capacitors fail to discharge [/b][-]

[FFFF00][b]Positively test electrical system for the presence of voltage[/b][-]

[FFFF00][b]If voltage measured is less than 50VDC proceed to work step 5[/b][-]

[FFFF00][b]If voltage measured is Above 50VDC proceed to work step 6[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Measure voltage on each capacitor

Steps.Instructions:
[FFFFFF]Apply the Capacitor shorting cable to one of the tested Capacitors[-]

[FFFFFF]Connect Capacitor shorting cable as shown[-]

[FFFFFF]Please Scissor clip on ground cable and lock with a Personal or Permit lock & tag[-]
Steps.Alerts:
[FFFF00][b]To prevent charging of Capacitors from any source after checking Capacitor voltage[/b][-]

[FFFF00][b]Placing isolation lock is as a reminder to remove shorting cable[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Apply Capacitor shorting cables to discharged and tested capacitors, less than 50VDC

Steps.Instructions:
[FFFFFF]Open Aux cab door and check Capacitor Discharge lights are illuminated[-][FFFFFF].[-]

[FFFFFF]Raise Barrier bar and lock in raised position via catch[-][FFFFFF].[-]

[FFFFFF]Place Personal lock & tag as per isolation regulations[-][FFFFFF].[-]

[FFFFFF]Check DC Link voltage (CDI) lights are extinguished approx. 200ms[-][FFFFFF].[-]
Steps.Alerts:
[FFFF00][b]If the lights remain illuminated, then the capacitor discharge system is likely to have failed (voltage >50VDC)[/b][-]

[FFFF00][b]Run Crank Transfer Switch (CTS) self-test and move CTS into the centre or propulsion position. [/b][-]

[FFFF00][b]If the LED’s remain lit, open the Battery switch in CA1 and verify LED’s are extinguished.[/b][-]

[FFFF00][b]Wait 20 minutes for Slow discharge prior to entry into Aux cab[/b][-][FFFF00][b].[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Accessing Aux Cab

Steps.Instructions:
[FFFFFF]Ensure suitably rated PPE gear is worn when performing this task[-][FFFFFF].[-]

[FFFFFF]Place one test probe on the positive (+) capacit[-][FFFFFF]or terminal, and the other test [-][FFFFFF]prove on the negative (-) capacitor terminal diagonally opposite, and record the voltage[-][FFFFFF].[-]

[FFFFFF]If voltage measured is less than 50VDC proceed to work step 5[-][FFFFFF].[-]

[FFFFFF]If voltage measured is Above 50VDC but less than 120VDC continue with work step 6.3[-][FFFFFF].[-]
Steps.Alerts: [FFFF00][b]Confirmation that all capacitors are discharged and remain discharged[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Measure voltage on each capacitor

Steps.Instructions:
[FFFFFF]With the Capacitor discharge lights off and measured Capacitor voltage above 50VDC but less than 120 VDC manual discharges is required.[-]

[FFFFFF]Connect manual discharge cable assy GND clamp to nearest ground block (GB3B, GB3C, GB3D)[-]

[FFFFFF]Connect DC+ clamp to DC+ of the charged capacitor terminal[-]

[FFFFFF]Connect DC- clamp to DC- of the charged capacitor terminal[-]

[FFFFFF]Repeat for all Capacitors[-]

[FFFFFF]Wait for at least 2 minutes[-]
Steps.Alerts: [FFFF00][b]If measured voltage is greater than 50VDC the automatic discharge system may have failed so a manual discharge is required[/b][-][FFFF00][b].[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Apply manual discharge tool to capacitors with voltage above 50VDC but less than 120VDC manual discharge is required

Steps.Instructions:
[FFFFFF]For all discharged and tested Capacitors apply the Tesco Capacitor shorting cables[-]

[FFFFFF]Connect Capacitor shorting cable assy GND clamp to nearest ground block (GB3B, GB3C, GB3D)[-]

[FFFFFF]Connect DC+ clamp to DC+ capacitor terminal[-]

[FFFFFF]Connect DC- clamp to DC- capacitor terminal[-]

[FFFFFF]Repeat for all Capacitors[-]
Steps.Alerts: [FFFF00][b]Confirmation that all capacitors are discharged and remain discharged[/b][-][FFFF00][b].[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Apply Capacitor shorting cables

Steps.Instructions:
1. [FFFFFF]Check all previous steps have been completed and work is at the required stage before contacting the Quality Control Team.[-]

2. [FFFFFF]Sign off on the computers.[-]

1. [FFFFFF]This WMS provides the step by step procedure for the disconnection and reconnection of the locomotive batteries.[-]

2. [FFFFFF]Each step [-][b][FFFFFF]MUST[-][/b][FFFFFF] be followed in order to safely and efficiently complete the task.[-]

3. [FFFFFF]Each step is outlined clearly in the Task section of this document.[-]
Steps.Components:
Materials:
Platform ladder/ mobile platform
Container to store nuts, bolts, and washers
 
Tools & Equipment:
Battery rattle gun
deep 19mm impact socket
Gloves
Safety glasses
2 x ½ inch geared spanners
300mm cable ties
Hearing protection
Steps.Alerts: [FFFF00][b]Refer to the Components tab for Material, Tools and Equipment[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Preparation - Mandatory

Steps.Instructions: [b][FFFFFF]Once the loco has come into the shed and is still under the driver’s possession, confirm the polarity of the BCCB circuit breaker [-][/b][b][FF0000](Dash 9 only).[-][/b][b][FFFFFF] Attach an information tag to the circuit breaker with the relevant information confirming if the polarity is correct or incorrect. Then turn all breakers on the ECP panel off and pull both knife switches to the disconnect position. [-][/b]
Steps.Alerts: [FF0000]Complete a Take 5 for confirming the polarity of the BCCB Circuit breaker.[-]
Steps.Title: Flick all breakers off and Pull knife switches

Steps.Instructions:
[b][FFFFFF]The capacitor [-][/b][b][FF0000]MUST [-][/b][b][FFFFFF]be checked at this stage for voltage.  [-][/b]

[b][FFFFFF]Whether or not voltage is present turn the BCCB breaker in the ECP panel [-][/b][b][FF0000]ON[-][/b][b][FFFFFF] to dissipate any energy from the capacitor.[-][/b]

[b][FFFFFF]Re-test the capacitor to ensure it has no voltage [-][/b]

[b][FFFFFF]Place info tag on the BCCB breaker stating the breaker should be left on to ensure the capacitor remains discharged.[-][/b]
Steps.Title: Use a calibrated and proven voltage tester to test between either side of the diode as shown and earth

Steps.Instructions: [FFFFFF]Master lock should already be attached to hasp, securing knife switch door closed. [-][0070C0](To eliminate the risk of there being a load on any circuits when batteries are connected, which could cause an arc flash)[-]
Steps.Title: Place personal lock on the hasp that is securing the knife switch door

Steps.Instructions: 1. [FFFFFF]Make sure you are able to perform the task comfortably and without over reaching.  [-][0070C0](Eliminates soft tissue injuries etc.)[-]
Steps.Title: Locate battery cover panels on driver’s side of loco and position platform ladder

Steps.Instructions:
[FFFFFF]Remove nuts, starting from the bottom row, working your way to the top. [-][0070C0](Panel is supported until the last nut)[-]

[FFFFFF]Place nuts and washers in a plastic bag/ container, and label with the loco number. [-][0070C0](Very important as these are imperial and there may be no spares).[-]
Steps.Alerts: [FFFF00][b]Place nuts and washers in a plastic bag/ container, and label with the loco number.[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Using the battery rattle gun and 19mm socket, remove 12 nuts and washers per panel

Steps.Instructions:
1. [FFFFFF]Remove panels[-][FFFFFF] [-]

2. [FFFFFF]Label with loco number and place on correct shelf on storage area.[-]
Steps.Title: Remove panels

Steps.Instructions:
1. [FFFFFF]It is imperative that the negative terminal is disconnected first. [-][0070C0](So a short circuit cannot be made later between positive and chassis with the spanner)[-]

2. [FFFFFF]Using ½ inch geared spanners, remove nuts, bolts and washers from negative battery terminal first. [-]

3. [FFFFFF]Using a cable tie, secure the lug away from the battery terminal so they cannot accidentally touch.[-]
Steps.Alerts: [FFFF00][b]It is imperative that the negative terminal is disconnected first.[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Remove the negative battery terminal

Steps.Instructions:
1. [FFFFFF]Disconnect positive terminal and secure the lug away from terminal using cable tie.[-]

2. [FFFFFF]Store all nuts, bolts and washers in the same bag/ container as the cover panel nuts and washers.[-]
Steps.Alerts:
[FFFF00][b]Store all nuts, bolts and washers in the same bag/ container as the cover panel nuts and washers[/b][-]

[FFFF00][b]Notify QC agents 30 minutes before completion[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Remove the positive battery terminal

Steps.Instructions:
1. [FFFFFF]Check all previous steps have been completed before contacting the Quality Control Team.[-]

2. [FFFFFF]Sign off to be completed on the computers.[-]

Steps.Title: Preparation - Mandatory

Steps.Instructions:
1. [FFFFFF]Use the template to mark the holes on the inside of the NV cab area. It should be placed 150mm from the right hand edge, and 95 mm from the top.  The area that is to be cut has pre-punched holes, adjust the position of the template so that you don’t cut through the top hole, and before repositioning the template ensure that the access panel will still fit. If need be the aperture can be reduced in size slightly to avoid existing holes.[-]

2. [FFFFFF]After marking out the corner points, drill the holes out to 10mm, and then use the hydraulic punch to increase the [-][FFFFFF]hole[-][FFFFFF] size to 32mm.[-]

3. [FFFFFF]Mark STRAIGHT[-][FF0000] [-][FFFFFF]lines between the outside of the 4 holes and cut out using a jigsaw and cutting lube. If necessary file the cuts straight. Install M6 [-][FFFFFF]rivnuts[-][FFFFFF] for holding rear cover, use rear cover to mark locations. [-][0070C0](We need to be able to access the rear of the NV rack, it is important that this hole is cut neatly as it will be visible every time the access panel is removed, and will not have [-][b][0070C0]edging[-][/b][0070C0] installed.)[-]

4. [FFFFFF]Ensure rear cover plate has a foam edge installed[-]
Steps.Alerts:

Steps.Instructions:
1. [FFFFFF]Remove the microwave/kettle outlet plate from the dashboard. [-][0070C0](To prevent electromagnetic interference affecting the antenna cables that run along the same route)[-]

2. [FFFFFF]Disconnect the supply cable (orange), and cut back all cable ties.[-]

3. [FFFFFF]In CA6 remove all cable ties holding the J2 inverter cable and pull down through the cable access hole, remove from loco.[-]

4. [FFFFFF]Install copper braid along the length of the cable, ensuring that the braid extends 75mm past the end of the outlet plate end of the cable, and stops just short of the inverter J2 plug.[-]

5. [FFFFFF]Slide a 50mm section of 25mm [-][FFFFFF]heatshrink[-][FFFFFF] down to the J2 end and shrink it over the loose end of the copper braid.[-]

6. [FFFFFF]Pull any slackness out of the braid towards the outlet end.[-]

7. [FFFFFF]At outlet end, locate where the outer sheath of the supply cable has been removed to, open up a hole in the copper braid app 10mm back from this point and pull the end of the cable out [-][FFFFFF]through the braid.[-]
Steps.Title: Braid microwave power supply cable

Steps.Instructions:
1. [FFFFFF]Install earth [-][FFFFFF]heatshrink[-][FFFFFF] over the tail of braid that is left, leaving enough exposed braid to put a 6mm m6 pre insulated lug onto, crimp lug onto braid.  Remove the microwave/kettle outlet plate from the dashboard. Disconnect the supply cable (orange), and cut back all cable ties. [-][0070C0]([-][0070C0]To prevent electromagnetic interference affecting the antenna cables that run along the same route[-][0070C0])[-]

2. [FFFFFF]In CA6 remove all cable ties holding the J2 inverter cable and pull down through the cable access hole, remove from loco.[-]

3. [FFFFFF]Install copper braid along the length of the cable, ensuring that the braid extends 75mm past the end of the outlet plate end of the cable, and stops just short of the inverter J2 plug.[-]

4. [FFFFFF]Slide a 50mm section of 25mm [-][FFFFFF]heatshrink[-][FFFFFF] down to the J2 end and shrink it over the loose end of the copper braid.[-]

5. [FFFFFF]Pull any slackness out of the braid towards the outlet end.  At outlet end, locate where the outer sheath of the supply cable has been removed to, open up a hole in the copper braid app 10mm back from this point and pull the end [-][FFFFFF]of the cable out through the braid.[-]
Steps.Title: Braid microwave power supply cable - continued

Steps.Instructions:
1. [FFFFFF]Install earth [-][FFFFFF]heatshrink[-][FFFFFF] over the tail of braid that is left, leaving enough exposed braid to put a 6mm m6 pre insulated lug onto, crimp lug onto braid.[-]

2. [FFFFFF]Slide nylon braid over the cable, stopping just short of the J2 plug.[-]

3. [FFFFFF]Use 50mm of 25mm [-][FFFFFF]heatshrink[-][FFFFFF] at the J2 end. [-]

4. [FFFFFF]DO NOT melt braid with heat gun, use low heat, and keep the airflow moving.[-]

5. [FFFFFF]Pull slackness out of braid towards outlet end of cable.[-]

6. [FFFFFF]Cut braiding level with the point that the cable exits the copper braid. [-]

7. [FFFFFF]Slide a 50mm section of 25mm [-][FFFFFF]heatshrink[-][FFFFFF] over the exposed end of the nylon braid.[-]

8. [FFFFFF]DO NOT melt braid with heat gun, use low heat, and keep the airflow moving.[-]

9. [FFFFFF]Reinstall cable in loco ensuring that the braid is earthed to the earth stud on the plate, the active cable goes to the common terminal of the switch, and the neutral and earth cores get re-terminated in the terminals that they came from.[-]
Steps.Title: Braid microwave power supply cable - continued

Definition.ImportantNotes:
[b][FF0000]Please read all of the[-][/b][b][FF0000] detailed tasks below carefully.  Before commencing work either sign the back page or select ‘Accept’ on the tablet.[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]Prior to commencing the task a JHA must also be completed, reviewed and signed.  Additionally a Take 5 must be conducted prior to commencing the task.[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]After completing each installation sub task ensure that you sign off each sub task as being completed in the WMS.[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]Please note – when tightening N-type connectors to “finger tight” this should be as tight as possible that can be achieved by hand, the connector should be “wobbled” after tightening then re-checked, this process should be repeated until the connector can no longer be tightened.[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]Any discrepancies between drawings and actual installation must be brought to the attention of your supervisor BEFORE proceeding with the task[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]WHEN INSTALLING EQUIPMENT [-][/b][b][FF0000]ENSURE[-][/b][b][FF0000] THAT NO WIRING IS BEING TRAPPED OR OTHERWISE DAMAGED.[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]ENSURE CABLE TIES ARE CUT FLUSH AND THAT THE TIE CAN BE ROTATED ON THE LOOM, THE KNUCKLE SHOULD BE TURNED SO THAT IT IS HIDDEN BEHIND THE LOOM.[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]EXCESS CABLE THAT CANNOT BE CUT BACK SHOULD NOT BE COILED, BUT RUN ALONG EXISTING LOOMS.[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]ALL QUALITY CHECKS MUST BE SIGNED OFF PRIOR TO ANY FURTHER WORK BEING CARRIED OUT.[-][/b]

[b][u][FF0000]ENSURE ALL BENDING RADIUSES ARE NOT EXCESSIVELY TIGHT[-][/u][/b]

[b][u][FF0000]CONDUCT A CRIMP TEST AND LOG IT IN QUALLITY ASSURANCE BOOK BEFORE ALL TERMINATIONS.[-][/u][/b]

[b][u][FF0000]RECORD ALL SERIAL NUMBERS WITHIN WMS BEFORE INSTALLATION OF EQUIPMENT[-][/u][/b]

[b][u][FF0000]PROTECT CORNERS OF POWER RACK DOOR WITH PINCHWELD OR FOAM. THIS WILL PREVENT ANY INJURY DURING INSTALLATION WORK.[-][/u][/b][b][FF0000] [-][/b]

Steps.Instructions:
[b][FFFFFF]TASK OVERVIEW:  [-][/b]

[FFFFFF]This WMS involves the installation of the Non-Vital cabinet and its components and the Installation of cable looms. Also included is the termination of the connections in the non-vital cabinet.[-]

[FFFFFF]Each step is outlined clearly in the Task section of this document.[-]

[b][u][FFFFFF]References:[-][/u][/b]

1. [FFFFFF]90000455.D10.EN – Evolution – Auto haul system wiring diagram[-]

2. [FFFFFF]90000452.D10.EN – Evolution – Power supply sub rack topographic[-]
Steps.Components:
Materials:
Non-Vital Cabinet
Data Radio Shelf
Gemini G3 radio modem
2 X 72v – 12 v Power supplies
MOXA SWITCH
NVR Rack
Power Supply Bracket
WIMAX modem
POE Injector
Copper braid
Nylon braid
150mm of 25mm black heatshrink
150mm 7mm earth heatshrink
M6 yellow pre-insulated ring lug

Tools & Equipment:
3/8” socket set
1/2” socket set
Heat gun
Pre-insulated lug crimper
Rivnut tool
Battery drill
Jigsaw w/ metal cutting blade
Steps.Alerts:
[FFFF00][b]Refer to attachment EVO - Power Supply Sub Rack External Connections[/b][-]

[FFFF00][b]Refer to the Components tab for Material, Tools and Equipment[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Preparation - Mandatory

Steps.Instructions:
1. [FFFFFF]Use the template to mark the holes on the inside of the NV cab area. It should be placed 150mm from the right hand edge, and 95 mm from the top.  The area that is to be cut has pre-punched holes, adjust the position of the template so that you don’t cut through the top hole, and before repositioning the template ensure that the access panel will still fit. If need be the aperture can be reduced in size slightly to avoid existing holes.[-]

2. [FFFFFF]After marking out the corner points, drill the holes out to 10mm, and then use the hydraulic punch to increase the hole size to 32mm.[-]

3. [FFFFFF]Mark STRAIGHT[-][FF0000] [-][FFFFFF]lines between the outside of the 4 holes and cut out using a jigsaw and cutting lube. If necessary file the cuts straight. Install M6 rivnuts for holding rear cover, use rear cover to mark locations. [-][0070C0](We need to be able to access the rear of the NV rack, it is important that this hole is cut neatly as it will be visible every time the access panel is removed, and will not have [-][b][0070C0]edging[-][/b][0070C0] installed.)[-]

4. [FFFFFF]Ensure rear cover plate has a foam edge installed[-]
Steps.Alerts:
[FFFF00][b]You must use the template to mark the 4 holes that will be used as centres for the hydraulic punch. [/b][-]

[FFFF00][b]Ensure rear cover plate has a foam edge installed[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Cut access panel; aperture in rear of NV cab area

Steps.Instructions:
1. [FFFFFF]Install segregation plate in the top of the NV cab aperture to cover the hole below the microwave GPO[-]

2. [FFFFFF]Secure using M6 bolts , washers and nyloc nuts[-]
Steps.Title: Install segregation plate

Steps.Instructions: 1. [FFFFFF]Trim the SHS in top right hand corner as per dimensions shown in photo. File edges smooth and fit pinch weld.[-]
Steps.Title: Trim SHS for power rack installation

Steps.Instructions:
1. [FFFFFF]Install the three 180mm tie bars evenly spaced as shown [-]

2. [FFFFFF]Install the two 600mm tie bars as shown[-]

3. [FFFFFF]The 600mm tie bar on the left install 150mm from the lip.[-]

4. [FFFFFF]The 600mm tie bar at the rear install 100mm from the bottom edge.[-]
Steps.Title: Install tie bars

Steps.Instructions:
1. [FFFFFF]All swarf, waste and filings must be cleaned up from the area. (To prevent rust, and to make area look nice)[-]

2. [FFFFFF]If floor of NV cab area is dirty, wipe it down with soapy water.[-]

3. [FFFFFF]Cold galv all exposed metal[-]
Steps.Alerts: [FFFF00][b]Notify QC agents 30 minutes before completion[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Clean up all swarf

Steps.Instructions:
1. [FFFFFF]Remove outlet and cable from NV area.[-]

2. [FFFFFF]Make cables safe at either end (Heat Shrink individual cores).[-]

3. [FFFFFF]Tie cable neatly into loom[-][FFFFFF].[-]
Steps.Title: Remove Fridge outlet

Steps.Instructions:
1. [FFFFFF]Using NV Rack, mark positions for fixing holes.[-]

2. [FFFFFF]Position NV Rack in NV area approx. 30mm back from front edge.[-]

3. [FFFFFF]Ensure rack is square within NV area.[-]

4. [FFFFFF]Mark holes as shown.[-]

5. [FFFFFF]Remove rack to drill holes.[-]

6. [FFFFFF]Drill to 13.5mm.[-]

7. [FFFFFF]Fit M8 Riv Nuts with a small amount of Loctite to aid securing Riv Nut.[-]

8. [FFFFFF]Re-install NV Rack.[-]
Steps.Title: Mark out fixing holes for base of cabinet

Steps.Instructions:
1. [FFFFFF]Fit brackets as shown, with angle behind the brown lip in NV area.[-]

      [FFFFFF]Riv Nuts should be inserted into bracket, not brown lip[-]

      [FFFFFF]Use Dome Head bolts to secure[-]
Steps.Alerts:
[FFFF00][b]Remove rack if cables have not been pulled in and prepped.[/b][-]

[FFFF00][b]Leave in place if electrical prep complete[/b][-][FFFFFF].[-]
Steps.Title: Mark and drill Fixing holes for left side securing brackets

Steps.Instructions:
1. [FFFFFF]Check all previous steps have been completed and work is at the required stage before contacting the Quality Control Team.[-]

2. [FFFFFF]Sign [-][FFFFFF]off to be completed [-][FFFFFF]on the computers.[-]
Steps.Title: Leading hand quality check

Steps.Instructions:
1. [FFFFFF]Check hole is cut neatly, tie bars are straight, rivnuts in for back cover, segregation plate installed, swarf cleaned, and all paperwork complete.[-][0070C0] [-][0070C0](ASTS and Calibre to inspect)[-]

2. [FFFFFF]Sign off quality assurance sheet.[-]

3. [FFFFFF]Sign off to be completed on the computers.[-]
Steps.Title: Quality Check

Steps.Instructions: 1. [FFFFFF]Prep tasks, such as fixing holes and fixings, penetrations, tie bars etc. should all be in place as this work is part of the conduit and cable tray WMS or this WMS.[-]
Steps.Title: Ensure NV Cab area has been prepared mechanically

Steps.Instructions:
1. [FFFFFF]Run the power cables that terminate at the TBNVC up the left hand tie bar.[-]

2. [FFFFFF]Protect the metal braiding that is to be terminated at the NV-CAB earth bar with green/yellow heat shrink. [-]

3. [FFFFFF]Allow 700mm of braiding and green/yellow heat shrink from the top of the tie bar.[-]

4. [FFFFFF]Tidy the nylon braiding with black heat shrink ending them at the same length to the top of the tie bar.[-]

[FF0000]Cables should be dressed up tire bar finishing 200mm from top of tie bar as shown[-]
Steps.Title: Dress the cables in that are to be terminated in the TBNVC

Steps.Instructions:
[b][FFFFFF]BTM-R[-][/b]

      [FFFFFF]Dress RX & TX cables up tie bar 435mm from base of NV area as shown[-]

      [FFFFFF]Dress DB 9 & 15 cables up tie bar 485mm[-]

      [FFFFFF]Nylon braid should end 200mm from tie bar as shown, the gland for entry to BTM module will be fitted at this point. Braided earth should also reach to this point as it will be terminated into gland[-]

[FF0000]Note:[-]

      [FF0000]Ensure braided earth reaches all the way to the point where the gland will be fitted[-]

      [FF0000]Ensure adequate length is left on the earth [-][FF0000]cable (earth bar is at the back of NV area)[-]

      [FF0000]Ensure cable looms are neat and as flat as possible to allow the NV Rack to be fitted[-]

[b][FFFFFF]BTM-N[-][/b]

      [FFFFFF]Dress RX & TX cables up tie bar 690mm from base of NV area as shown[-]

      [FFFFFF]Dress DB 9 & DB15 cables up tie bar 730mm[-]

      [FFFFFF]Nylon braid should end 200mm from tie bar as shown, the gland for entry to BTM module will be fitted at this point. Braided earth should also reach to this point as it will be terminated into gland[-]

[FF0000]Note:[-]

      [FF0000]Ensure braided earth reaches all the way to the point where the gland will be fitted[-]

      [FF0000]Ensure adequate length is left on the earth cable (earth bar is at the back of NV area)[-]

      [FF0000]Ensure cable looms are neat and as flat as possible to allow the NV Rack to be fitted[-]
Steps.Title: Dress and prep BTM cables

Steps.Instructions:
[FFFFFF]MOXA A[-]

      [FFFFFF]Dress MOXA A cables up tie bar 730mm from base of NV area as shown[-]

[FFFFFF]MOXA B[-]

      [FFFFFF]Dress MOXA B cables up tie bar 485mm from base of NV area as shown[-]

[FFFFFF]NOTE:[-]

[FFFFFF]Leave only 500mm length in cable from tie bar to connector as shown[-]
Steps.Title: Dress and prep MOXA cables

Steps.Instructions:
[b][FFFFFF]3X Temp Sensor cables total:[-][/b]

      [FFFFFF]2X cables from Fridge Cab entering NV via rear, top, right cable entry[-]

      [FFFFFF]1X cable from Alcove entering from penetration at base of NV area[-]

      [FFFFFF]Temp Sensor cables should be dressed along rear left tie bar 300mm from NV area base (cable run to WIMAX Tray on NV Rack)[-]

[FFFFFF]Any cables entering through rear, top, right cable entry that will be terminated at Power Rack should be dressed along top tie bar at this stage[-]

[FFFFFF]       [-][FF0000]Note: Dress cables in neatly and [-][b][FF0000]do not[-][/b][FF0000] make bending radius of cables to tight. Any slack cable should be coiled neatly in to a loom and cable tide.[-]

[FF0000]NOT TAPED TOGETHER[-]
Steps.Title: Dress and prep Temp Sensor cables for WIMAX Tray

Steps.Instructions:
[FFFFFF]2x Grey CDS cables entre NV area via rear, top, right cable entry[-]

      [FFFFFF]Cables are marked-Switch A & Switch B[-]

      [FFFFFF]Dress cables with MOXA cables for respective switches[-]

      [FFFFFF]       [-][FF0000]Note: Dress cables in neatly and [-][b][FF0000]do not[-][/b][FF0000] make bending radius of cables to tight[-]
Steps.Title: Dress and prep CDS cables

Steps.Instructions:
[0070C0](These need to be connected prior to rack going in or the connection point will not be accessible)[-]

1. [FFFFFF]At the rear of the NV cab area, [-][FFFFFF]drill new hole for earthing chassis point. As in location in attached photos[-][FFFFFF].[-]

2. [FFFFFF]Using one of the redundant ½” bolts, washers and spring washers from the fridge base, connect two 10mm earths to the locomotive chassis, install a star washer between the earth lugs and the nut.[-]

3. [b][FF0000]All equipment earths to be connected to these two earth studs[-][/b]

4. [b][FF0000]File down studs for better connection[-][/b]

5. [b][FF0000]Use star washer[-][/b]

6. [b][FF0000]Use 10mmx12mm lugs[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]Tie earth cables up rear right tie bar to required earth bar heights[-][/b]
Steps.Alerts: [b][FF0000]There is no available earthing point similar to that on a DC Loco.[-][/b]
Steps.Title: Connect chassis earths for upper and lower earth bars

Steps.Instructions:
1. [FFFFFF]All conduits and large penetration in floor of NV cab must be filled with fire resistant putty [-][0070C0](To prevent heat transfer and in case of fire)[-]

[FFFFFF]Leave a draw wire in large slotted penetration so Sat modem cable can be pulled through to Alcove[-]

[FFFFFF]Fit Pinch Weld around rear, top, right cable entry[-]
Steps.Alerts: [FFFF00][b]Notify QC agent 30 minutes before completion[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Install putty in holes

Steps.Instructions:
[FFFFFF]2x WIMAX Antenna cables entre NV area VIA rear, top, right cable entry[-]

      [FFFFFF]Dress cables down tie bar and group with Temp Sensor cables leaving 1200mm from [-][FFFFFF]tie bar to RF 2 connector[-]

[FF0000]Note:[-]

      [FF0000]Leave enough slack on the cables so the WIMAX Tray can be pulled in and out[-]

[FF0000]Loom cables from connectors leaving 160mm spacing between each end, RF1 should be the longest of the two cables[-]
Steps.Title: Prep WIMAX Antenna cables

Steps.Instructions:
[b][FFFFFF]Protect Cables using the following method:[-][/b]

      [FFFFFF]Fit a 900mm length of 16mm split corrugated conduit over cables, starting [-][FF0000]440mm from the Duplex Antenna end.[-]

      [FFFFFF]Feed cables and corrugated conduit through a 1m length of 25mm heat shrink. Antenna cable plugs should be staggered and a draw wire used to aid pulling cables through. Use lube as an aid.[-]

      [FFFFFF]Shrink heat shrink leaving equal lengths overlapping either end of corrugated conduit.[-]

      [FFFFFF]Slide 1.1m black poly braid over conduit and heat shrink, as done with heat shrink, leave equal lengths of poly braid overlapping at each end. Braid should be pulled taught with no twists. Tape ends.[-]

      [FFFFFF]Use 2x 80mm lengths of 25mm heat shrink (1 at either end) to seal the ends of the braid around cable[-]

      [FFFFFF]Cable connectors should be staggered as shown[-]

[5B9BD5]Cables require protection from pinch points when Data Radio Tray is moved in and out.[-]
Steps.Title: Prep Data Radio Antenna cables

Steps.Instructions:
[FFFFFF]Cables entre NV area via rear, top, right cable entry[-]

      [FFFFFF]Tie cables down tie bars 400mm from the base of the NV area, as shown leave 1900mm length from tie bar to antenna connector[-]
Steps.Title: Prep Data Radio Antenna cables - continued

Steps.Instructions:
[b][FFFFFF]Through cut out at back of NV Rack:[-][/b]

      [FFFFFF]Using draw wire in penetration at base of NV area pull Sat Phone cable through to Alcove[-]
Steps.Title: Pull Sat Phone cable into Alcove

Steps.Instructions: 1. [FFFFFF]Carry out cable count, all cables should be in NV area at this stage.[-]
Steps.Title: Carry out cable count

Steps.Instructions:
1. [FFFFFF]Check all previous steps have been completed and work is at the required stage before contacting the Quality Control Team.[-]

2. [FFFFFF]Sign off[-][FFFFFF] to be completed[-][FFFFFF] on the computers.[-]

Steps.Alerts: [FFFF00][b]Dress cables in neatly and [/b][-][b][FFFF00]do not[-][/b][FFFF00][b] make bending radius of cables to tight.[/b][-]

Steps.Title: Install power supply rack

Steps.Instructions:
1. [FFFFFF]These are secured to the [-][b][FFFFFF]NV-CAB [-][/b][FFFFFF]using M6 X 15mm Bolts.[-]

2. [FFFFFF]BTM-N is on the upper shelf, and is for the short hood end antenna.[-]

3. [FFFFFF]BTM-R is on the lower shelf, and is for the long hood end antenna .[-]

4. [FFFFFF]Be careful when installing the BTM antennas so that the paintwork does not get damaged.[-]

5. [FFFFFF]Dress the earths in to the glands as shown in the attached picture.[-]

6. [FFFFFF]The glands for the BTM antenna cables are to be installed off the locomotive as a prep task. [-][FFFFFF]As per photos 3 & 4.[-]

7. [FFFFFF]The correct tools for the installation of the glands are a spanner, if this is not available then use multigrips.[-]

Steps.Instructions:
1. [FFFFFF]Refer document [-][FFFFFF]90000972.D02.EN[-]

2. [FFFFFF]Follow the document and install to BTM Normal.[-]

3. [FFFFFF]Terminate and dress in cables as per photo.[-]

[FFFFFF]4.  Please ensure there is an air gap between the     bottom of the loom and the shelf so the BTM cover can be fitted.  [-]
Steps.Alerts: [FFFF00][b]Refer attachment [/b][-][FFFF00][b]90000972.D02.EN[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Terminate J3 Harness to BTM

Steps.Instructions:
1. [FFFFFF]Ascertain which plug is for which cable and put the ferrule onto the cable.[-]

2. [FFFFFF]Strip the cable per the diagram attached.[-]

3. [FFFFFF]Crimp the pin onto the centre conductor.[-]

4. [FFFFFF]Install the plug body.[-]

5. [FFFFFF]Push the ferrule up to the plug body.[-]

6. [FFFFFF]Execute ONE crimp at the end closest to the plug; this should leave a small amount of the ferrule un-crimped at the end furthest from the plug.[-]
Steps.Title: Terminate and connect BTM antenna cables

Steps.Instructions:
1. [FFFFFF]Power earths are to be terminated to the upper earth bar.[-]

2. [FFFFFF]Screens are to be terminated to the middle earth bar.[-]

3. [FFFFFF]Equipment earths are to be terminated to the bottom earth bar.[-]

Steps.Title: Quality Check

Definition.ImportantNotes:
[b][FF0000]Please read all of the[-][/b][b][FF0000] detailed tasks below carefully.  Before commencing work either sign the back page or select ‘Accept’ on the tablet.[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]Prior to commencing the task a JHA must also be completed, reviewed and signed.  Additionally a Take 5 must be conducted prior to commencing the task.[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]After completing each installation sub task ensure that you sign off each sub task as being completed in the WMS.[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]Please note – when tightening N-type connectors to “finger tight” this should be as tight as possible that can be achieved by hand, the connector should be “wobbled” after tightening then re-checked, this process should be repeated until the connector can no longer be tightened.[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]Any discrepancies between drawings and actual installation must be brought to the attention of your supervisor BEFORE proceeding with the task[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]WHEN INSTALLING EQUIPMENT ENSURE THAT NO WIRING IS BEING TRAPPED OR OTHERWISE DAMAGED.[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]ENSURE CABLE TIES ARE CUT FLUSH AND THAT THE TIE CAN BE ROTATED ON THE LOOM, THE KNUCKLE SHOULD BE TURNED SO THAT IT IS HIDDEN BEHIND THE LOOM.[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]EXCESS CABLE THAT CANNOT BE CUT BACK SHOULD NOT BE COILED, BUT RUN ALONG EXISTING LOOMS.[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]ALL QUALITY CHECKS MUST BE SIGNED OFF PRIOR TO ANY FURTHER WORK BEING CARRIED OUT.[-][/b]

[b][u][FF0000]ENSURE ALL BENDING RADIUSES ARE NOT EXCESSIVELY TIGHT[-][/u][/b]

[b][u][FF0000]CONDUCT A CRIMP TEST AND LOG IT IN QUALLITY ASSURANCE BOOK BEFORE ALL TERMINATIONS.[-][/u][/b]

[b][u][FF0000]RECORD ALL SERIAL NUMBERS WITHIN WMS BEFORE INSTALLATION OF EQUIPMENT[-][/u][/b]

[b][u][FF0000]PROTECT CORNERS OF POWER RACK DOOR WITH PINCHWELD OR FOAM. THIS WILL PREVENT ANY INJURY DURING INSTALLATION WORK.[-][/u][/b][b][FF0000] [-][/b]

Steps.Instructions:
1. [FFFFFF]Inspect Locomotive entry points.[-]

2. [FFFFFF]Ensure Roads are locked out and the Locomotive isolated. [-][0070C0](Locomotive can be moved or other rolling stock can enter work area)[-]

3. [FFFFFF]Ensure that safe working protection is in place. [-]

4. [FFFFFF]Refer to Isolation matrix for lockout points.[-]

5. [FFFFFF]Ensure entry walkways are properly secured with straps, & barriers are across any gaps. [-][0070C0](Falling down to the pit can occur[-][0070C0])[-]

[FFFF00][b]Ask your Permit Isolation Officer or Administrator if unsure of isolation.  [/b][-]

[FFFF00][b]Trips and falls can occur whilst boarding Locomotive, unwanted movement of walkways can occur[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Sign on to permit of isolation and lock on

Steps.Instructions:
[b][FFFFFF]TASK OVERVIEW:  [-][/b]

[FFFFFF]This WMS involves the installation of the Non-Vital cabinet and its components and the Installation of cable looms. Also included is the termination of the connections in the non-vital cabinet.[-]

[FFFFFF]Each step is outlined clearly in the Task section of this document.[-]

[b][u][FFFFFF]References:[-][/u][/b]

1. [FFFFFF]90000455.D10.EN – Evolution – Auto haul system wiring diagram[-]

2. [FFFFFF]90000452.D10.EN – Evolution – Power supply sub rack topographic[-]
Steps.Components:
Materials:
Non-Vital Cabinet
Data Radio Shelf
Gemini G3 radio modem
2 X 72v – 12 v Power supplies
MOXA SWITCH
NVR Rack
Power Supply Bracket
WIMAX modem
POE Injector
Copper braid
Nylon braid
150mm of 25mm black heatshrink
150mm 7mm earth heatshrink
M6 yellow pre-insulated ring lug

Tools & Equipment:
3/8” socket set
1/2” socket set
Heat gun
Pre-insulated lug crimper
Rivnut tool
Battery drill
Jigsaw w/ metal cutting blade
Steps.Alerts:
[FFFF00][b]Refer to attachment EVO - Power Supply Sub Rack External Connections[/b][-]

[FFFF00][b]Refer to the Components tab for Material, Tools and Equipment[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Preparation - Mandatory

Steps.Instructions:
1. [FFFFFF]Use the template to mark the holes on the inside of the NV cab area. It should be placed 150mm from the right hand edge, and 95 mm from the top.  The area that is to be cut has pre-punched holes, adjust the position of the template so that you don’t cut through the top hole, and before repositioning the template ensure that the access panel will still fit. If need be the aperture can be reduced in size slightly to avoid existing holes.[-]

2. [FFFFFF]After marking out the corner points, drill the holes out to 10mm, and then use the hydraulic punch to increase the hole size to 32mm.[-]

3. [FFFFFF]Mark STRAIGHT[-][FF0000] [-][FFFFFF]lines between the outside of the 4 holes and cut out using a jigsaw and cutting lube. If necessary file the cuts straight. Install M6 rivnuts for holding rear cover, use rear cover to mark locations. Steps.Instructions:
[b][FFFFFF]Protect Cables using the following method:[-][/b]

      [FFFFFF]Fit a 900mm length of 16mm split corrugated conduit over cables, starting [-][FF0000]440mm from the Duplex Antenna end.[-]

      [FFFFFF]Feed cables and corrugated conduit through a 1m length of 25mm heat shrink. Antenna cable plugs should be staggered and a draw wire used to aid pulling cables through. Use lube as an aid.[-]

      [FFFFFF]Shrink heat shrink leaving equal lengths overlapping either end of corrugated conduit.[-]

      [FFFFFF]Slide 1.1m black poly braid over conduit and heat shrink, as done with heat shrink, leave equal lengths of poly braid overlapping at each end. Braid should be pulled taught with no twists. Tape ends.[-]

      [FFFFFF]Use 2x 80mm lengths of 25mm heat shrink (1 at either end) to seal the ends of the braid around cable[-]

      [FFFFFF]Cable connectors should be staggered as shown[-]

[5B9BD5]Cables require protection from pinch points when Data Radio Tray is moved in and out.[-]

Steps.Title: Quality Check

Definition.ImportantNotes:
[b][FF0000]Please read all of the[-][/b][b][FF0000] detailed tasks below carefully.  Before commencing work either sign the back page or select ‘Accept’ on the tablet.[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]Prior to commencing the task a JHA must also be completed, reviewed and signed.  Additionally a Take 5 must be conducted prior to commencing the task.[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]After completing each installation sub task ensure that you sign off each sub task as being completed in the WMS.[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]Please note – when tightening N-type connectors to “finger tight” this should be as tight as possible that can be achieved by hand, the connector should be “wobbled” after tightening then re-checked, this process should be repeated until the connector can no longer be tightened.[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]Any discrepancies between drawings and actual installation must be brought to the attention of your supervisor BEFORE proceeding with the task[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]WHEN INSTALLING EQUIPMENT ENSURE THAT NO WIRING IS BEING TRAPPED OR OTHERWISE DAMAGED.[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]ENSURE CABLE TIES ARE CUT FLUSH AND THAT THE TIE CAN BE ROTATED ON THE LOOM, THE KNUCKLE SHOULD BE TURNED SO THAT IT IS HIDDEN BEHIND THE LOOM.[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]EXCESS CABLE THAT CANNOT BE CUT BACK SHOULD NOT BE COILED, BUT RUN ALONG EXISTING LOOMS.[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]ALL QUALITY CHECKS MUST BE SIGNED OFF PRIOR TO ANY FURTHER WORK BEING CARRIED OUT.[-][/b]

[b][u][FF0000]ENSURE ALL BENDING RADIUSES ARE NOT EXCESSIVELY TIGHT[-][/u][/b]

[b][u][FF0000]CONDUCT A CRIMP TEST AND LOG IT IN QUALLITY ASSURANCE BOOK BEFORE ALL TERMINATIONS.[-][/u][/b]

[b][u][FF0000]RECORD ALL SERIAL NUMBERS WITHIN WMS BEFORE INSTALLATION OF EQUIPMENT[-][/u][/b]

[b][u][FF0000]PROTECT CORNERS OF POWER RACK DOOR WITH PINCHWELD OR FOAM. THIS WILL PREVENT ANY INJURY DURING INSTALLATION WORK.[-][/u][/b][b][FF0000] [-][/b]

Steps.Instructions:
[b][FFFFFF]TASK OVERVIEW:  [-][/b]

[FFFFFF]This WMS involves the installation of the Non-Vital cabinet and its components and the Installation of cable looms. Also included is the termination of the connections in the non-vital cabinet.[-]

[FFFFFF]Each step is outlined clearly in the Task section of this document.[-]

[b][u][FFFFFF]References:[-][/u][/b]

1. [FFFFFF]90000452.D10.EN – Evolution – Power supply sub rack topographic[-]

Materials:
Non-Vital Cabinet
Data Radio Shelf
Gemini G3 radio modem
2 X 72v – 12 v Power supplies
MOXA SWITCH
NVR Rack
Power Supply Bracket
WIMAX modem
POE Injector
Copper braid
Nylon braid
150mm of 25mm black heatshrink
150mm 7mm earth heatshrink

Tools & Equipment:
3/8” socket set
1/2” socket set
Heat gun
Pre-insulated lug crimper
Rivnut tool
Battery drill
Jigsaw w/ metal cutting blade

Steps.Instructions:
1. [FFFFFF]Use the template to mark the holes on the inside of the NV cab area. It should be placed 150mm from the right hand edge, and 95 mm from the top.  The area that is to be cut has pre-punched holes, adjust the position of the template so that you don’t cut through the top hole, and before repositioning the template ensure that the access panel will still fit. If need be the aperture can be reduced in size slightly to avoid existing holes.[-]

2. [FFFFFF]After marking out the corner points, drill the holes out to 10mm, and then use the hydraulic punch to increase the [-][FFFFFF]hole[-][FFFFFF] size to 32mm.[-]

3. [FFFFFF]Mark STRAIGHT[-][FF0000] [-][FFFFFF]lines between the outside of the 4 holes and cut out using a jigsaw and cutting lube. If necessary file the cuts straight. Install M6 [-][FFFFFF]rivnuts[-][FFFFFF] for holding rear cover, use rear cover to mark locations. [-][0070C0](We need to be able to access the rear of the NV rack, it is important that this hole is cut neatly as it will be visible every time the access panel is removed, and will not have [-][b][0070C0]edging[-][/b][0070C0] installed.)[-]

4. [FFFFFF]Ensure rear cover plate has a foam edge installed[-]

Definition.ImportantNotes:
[b][FF0000]Please read all of the[-][/b][b][FF0000] detailed tasks below carefully.  Before commencing work either sign the back page or select ‘Accept’ on the tablet.[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]Prior to commencing the task a JHA must also be completed, reviewed and signed.  Additionally a Take 5 must be conducted prior to commencing the task.[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]After completing each installation sub task ensure that you sign off each sub task as being completed in the WMS.[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]Please note – when tightening N-type connectors to “finger tight” this should be as tight as possible that can be achieved by hand, the connector should be “wobbled” after tightening then re-checked, this process should be repeated until the connector can no longer be tightened.[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]Any discrepancies between drawings and actual installation must be brought to the attention of your supervisor BEFORE proceeding with the task[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]WHEN INSTALLING EQUIPMENT [-][/b][b][FF0000]ENSURE[-][/b][b][FF0000] THAT NO WIRING IS BEING TRAPPED OR OTHERWISE DAMAGED.[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]ENSURE CABLE TIES ARE CUT FLUSH AND THAT THE TIE CAN BE ROTATED ON THE LOOM, THE KNUCKLE SHOULD BE TURNED SO THAT IT IS HIDDEN BEHIND THE LOOM.[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]EXCESS CABLE THAT CANNOT BE CUT BACK SHOULD NOT BE COILED, BUT RUN ALONG EXISTING LOOMS.[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]ALL QUALITY CHECKS MUST BE SIGNED OFF PRIOR TO ANY FURTHER WORK BEING CARRIED OUT.[-][/b]

[b][u][FF0000]ENSURE ALL BENDING RADIUSES ARE NOT EXCESSIVELY TIGHT[-][/u][/b]

[b][u][FF0000]CONDUCT A CRIMP TEST AND LOG IT IN QUALLITY ASSURANCE BOOK BEFORE ALL TERMINATIONS.[-][/u][/b]

[b][u][FF0000]RECORD ALL SERIAL NUMBERS WITHIN WMS BEFORE INSTALLATION OF EQUIPMENT[-][/u][/b]

[b][u][FF0000]PROTECT CORNERS OF POWER RACK DOOR WITH PINCHWELD OR FOAM. THIS WILL PREVENT ANY INJURY DURING INSTALLATION WORK.[-][/u][/b][b][FF0000] [-][/b]

PublishedWMSDocument.FileName: V01.03_TBA - AC - NON VITAL CABINET INSTALLATION WMS.docx

Definition.Title: AC - Non Vital Cabinet Installation WMS

Steps.Instructions:
[FFFFFF]DO NOT work on, perform maintenance, or repair capacitors until all capacitors are proven discharged as per this document.[-]

[FFFFFF]Do not touch the capacitors or any conductor attached to a capacitor before or during the discharge procedure[-][FFFFFF].[-]

[b][FFFFFF]Only authorised [-][/b][b][FFFFFF]electrical [-][/b][b][FFFFFF]personnel are allowed to perform [-][/b][b][FFFFFF]tasks[-][/b][b][FFFFFF] as [-][/b][b][FFFFFF]outlined in [-][/b][b][FFFFFF]this procedure[-][/b][b][FFFFFF].[-][/b]

[b][FF0000]Ensure that Permit Isolation locks are placed by the Permit Isolation Officer, as required in below steps.[-][/b]

[FFFFFF]Refer to Isolation matrix for lockout points.[-]
Steps.Alerts: [b][FFFF00]Read and u[-][/b][b][FFFF00]nderstand the workflow and safety aspects of the task[-][/b][b][FFFF00] before commencing work.[-][/b]
Steps.Title: Read through this WMS

Steps.Instructions:
[FFFFFF]All individuals shall complete a Take 5 before commencing the task.[-]

[FFFFFF]Read, understand & sign onto the relevant JSEA.[-]

[FFFFFF]Personnel must[-][FFFFFF],[-][FFFFFF] at all times[-][FFFFFF],[-][FFFFFF] wear [-][FFFFFF]appropriate PPE[-][FFFFFF] issued to them as required by their location and task[-][FFFFFF].[-]
Steps.Alerts:
[FFFF00][b]Identifies all hazards associated with the task.[/b][-]

[FFFF00][b]No work commences until controls are implemented for any hazards identified[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Sign onto JSEA & complete a Take 5

Steps.Instructions:
[FFFFFF]Check the Multi-Meter for calibration and test date, if out of date do not use.[-]

[FFFFFF]Check for correct operation of Multi-Meter by measuring voltage of a known supply for example[-][FFFFFF]:[-][FFFFFF] locomotive battery charge knife switch[-]
Steps.Alerts: [FFFF00][b]Testing is required to confirm working condition of test equipment on a known live source. Note: test [/b][-][FFFF00][b]equipment[/b][-][FFFF00][b] should be re-tested after checking capacitors to confirm [/b][-][FFFF00][b]it[/b][-][FFFF00][b] is still in [/b][-][FFFF00][b]correct [/b][-][FFFF00][b]working order.[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Check condition of test equipment

Steps.Instructions:
[FFFFFF]With the Engine running[-][FFFFFF], [-][FFFFFF]Open Aux cab door and check Capacitor Discharge [-][FFFFFF]LED[-][FFFFFF]’[-][FFFFFF]s[-][FFFFFF] [-][b][FF0000]are illuminated[-][/b][b][FF0000].[-][/b]

[FFFFFF]Barrier bar must remain in the lowered position[-][FFFFFF].[-]

[b][FFFFFF]No Entry into the Auxiliary cab at this time is permitted[-][/b][b][FFFFFF].[-][/b]
Steps.Alerts: [FFFF00][b]If the capacitor discharge LED’s are not illuminated when the auxiliary cab door is opened, then the discharge circuitry is likely to have failed.   If this occurs, report it immediately to your supervisor, and continue to step 2.2.[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Checking Discharge lights are ON

Steps.Instructions:
[FFFFFF]Shut down locomotive as per normal procedure.[-]

[FFFFFF]Open both Knife Switches.[-]

[FFFFFF]Lock Battery Switch door in closed position.[-]

[FFFFFF]Perform clear and trial by attempting to start diesel engine.[-][FFFFFF] [-]
Steps.Alerts:
[b][FFFFFF]Take No[-][/b][b][FFFFFF]te:[-][/b]

[FFFF00][b]Makes others aware that the machine is under isolation[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Isolate Locomotive and verify Isolation

Steps.Instructions:
[FFFFFF]Raise Barrier bar and lock in raised position via catch.  Permit isolation officer will apply permit lock[-][FFFFFF] to the mechanism[-][FFFFFF].  [-]

[FFFFFF]Check DC Link voltage (CDI) LED’s [-][b][FF0000]are[-][/b][FFFFFF] [-][b][FF0000]extinguished.  [-][/b][FFFFFF]This should occur within approx. 200ms, so it is unlikely that you will see the LED’s illuminated at this stage.[-]

[FFFFFF]If CDI LED’s are extinguished, then continue with locomotive isolation.[-]
Steps.Alerts:
[FFFF00][b]Note:  If CDI LED’s remain illuminated, then the capacitor discharge system is likely to have failed (voltage is above 50vdc).  [/b][-]

[FFFF00][b]Wait 20 minutes before entry into aux cab in order for the permanently connected bleed resistor bank to discharge the capacitors.[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Check CDI LEDs are extinguished

Steps.Instructions: [FFFFFF]Switch on the meter to[-][FFFFFF] DC volts[-][FFFFFF] and test [-][FFFFFF] by placing one test probe on the positive (+) Wire 5BX[-][FFFFFF] termination, on the line side of the open[-][FFFFFF] battery switch[-][FFFFFF],[-][FFFFFF] and the other test probe on the negative (-) 5BY Wire [-][FFFFFF]termination, on the line side of the open[-][FFFFFF] battery switch[-][FFFFFF]. [-][FFFFFF] [-][FFFFFF]The meter[-][FFFFFF] should [-][FFFFFF]display between 60-74VDC[-][FFFFFF].[-]
Steps.Alerts:
[FFFF00][b]Ensure correctly rated PPE is worn when carrying out this task.[/b][-]

[FFFF00][b]Ensure meter is displaying correct voltage before proceeding with the next step.[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Turn on meter and test basic functions

Steps.Instructions:
[FFFFFF]Enter Auxiliary Cab and whilst [-][b][u][FF0000]remaining in a position of safety[-][/u][/b][FFFFFF], clear of the capacitor bank, visually inspect the capacitor linking bars for damage.[-]

[FFFFFF]If any damage to the linking bars is evident, especially if it is likely to have resulted in an open circuit, [-][b][u][FF0000]report it to your supervisor immediately[-][/u][/b][FFFFFF], and ensure all personnel vacate the Auxiliary Cab.  Lock the door, and place a personal danger tag, to inform others that it is not safe to enter.  Inform Permit Isolation Officer that you have taken the above step and the reason why.[-]

[FFFFFF]If any damage to link[-][FFFFFF]ing[-][FFFFFF] bars is found, RSM will need to be contacted, to effect repairs, and capacitor discharge, before work in the Auxiliary Cab can commence.[-]
Steps.Alerts:
[FFFF00][b]Do not touch any part of the capacitor bank nor any of the associated [/b][-][FFFF00][b]circuitry.[/b][-][FFFFFF] [-]

[FFFF00][b]If the linking bars become open circuit, it is possible that one or more of the capacitors may remain charged with dangerous voltage.[/b][-]
Steps.Title: Inspect interlinking capacitor buss bars for damage

Steps.Instructions:
[FFFFFF]Ensure suitably rated PPE is worn when performing this task[-][FFFFFF].[-]

[FFFFFF]After inspecting capacitor linking bars, and provided [-][b][u][FF0000]no faults or damage[-][/u][/b][FFFFFF] are evident, voltage readings can be taken.[-]

[FFFFFF]Place one test probe on the positive (+) capacitor terminal, and the other test probe on the negative (-) capacitor terminal diagonally opposite, and record the voltage.[-]

[FFFFFF] [-]

[b][FFFFFF]If voltage measured is less than 50VDC proceed to NEXT STEP[-][/b][b][FFFFFF].[-][/b]

[b][FFFFFF]If voltage measured is above 50VDC, advise your supervisor and do not proceed with work in Auxiliary Cab.                                                                                             [-][/b]
Steps.Alerts:

[FFFF00][b]If voltage measured is less than 50VDC proceed to work step 5[/b][-]

Steps.Title: Measure voltage on each capacitor

Steps.Instructions:
[FFFFFF]After measuring capacitor voltage, and if the measured voltage is [-][b][u][FF0000]less than 50VDC[-][/u][/b][FFFFFF], apply the Capacitor shorting cable to one of the tested Capacitors as per below instruction. [-][b][FF0000]Correct PPE must be worn.[-][/b]

[FFFFFF]Apply the Tesco shorting cable to the [-][b][FF0000]discharged[-][/b][FFFFFF] capacitor bank[-][FFFFFF] [-]

1. [FFFFFF]Connect Capacitor shorting cable GND clamp to nearest ground block (GB3B, GB3C, GB3D) [-]

2. [FFFFFF]Connect DC+ clamp to DC+ capacitor terminal [-]

3. [FFFFFF]Connect DC- clamp to DC- capacitor terminal [-]

[FFFFFF]Permit Isolation Officer to place scissor clip and permit lock on ground cable after shorting cable has been applied to the capacitor[-][FFFFFF] bank[-][FFFFFF].[-]
